page.title: 09SHOPS
page.content: Crosshill used to have several shops which sold groceries,newspapers,fruit and vegetables,butcher meat,fish and bread.Now vans visit the village,some daily and others on alternate days,to sell these goods to the locals.The Post Office is also a food store.One of the local farms has a butcher shop. Some families travel to Maybole or Ayr to do weekly shopping and to restock the freezer.A Mobile Bank visits once a week on a Monday morning. Until four years ago there were four shops in Kirkmichael.One was a butcher shop and the other three were general food stores.There are now only two food stores one of which includes a Post Office.
